intro: Poranthera dissecta, commonly known as the fringed pimpernel, is a flowering plant native to California. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has finely dissected, hairy leaves that give it a feathery appearance. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Poranthera dissecta is a short-lived perennial that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds.
